restrictIP_h.allow_deny_Txt: Enable IP Address Filtering - Checking this box enables the IP address filtering function. Once enabled, the addresses
restrictIP_h.allow_deny_continue_Txt1: in the list of IP addresses will be allowed or denied access to the Axis product.
restrictIP_h.allow_deny_continue_Txt2: All other IP addresses not in this list will be allowed or denied access accordingly, i.e. if the addresses in the list are allowed, then all others are denied access and vice versa. Do not forget to add the IP addresses of other network devices that may need access to the product,for example NTP server.
restrictIP_h.allow_deny_continue_Txt3: Select Allow or Deny from the drop-down list and click the Apply button to enable.
restrictIP_h.allow_Txt: Enable IP Address Filtering - Checking this box enables the IP address filtering function. Once enabled, only the addresses
restrictIP_h.allow_continue_Txt: shown in the list of allowed IP addresses will be permitted to access the product, all others will be blocked. Click the Apply button to enable.
restrictIP_h.filtered_Txt: Filtered IP Addresses - This list box shows the currently configured IP addresses. Up to 256 IP address entries may be specified (a single entry can contain multiple IP addresses). Click the Add button to
restrictIP_h.allowed_Txt: Allowed IP Addresses - This list box shows the currently configured IP addresses. Up to 256 IP address entries may be specified (a single entry can contain multiple IP addresses). Click the Add button to
restrictIP_h.removeTxt: To remove an address entry from the list, select it and click the Remove button.
restrictIP_h.refer_Txt1: Only allow referrals from - As the video stream from the product can be included in any web page, it is in theory also possible for unauthorized sources to include the stream in other pages.
restrictIP_h.refer_Txt2: To prevent unauthorized referrals, enter the IP addresses or host names of allowed referrers in the field provided and check the box to enable. Multiple addresses can be separated by semicolons (;)
restrictIP_h.refer_Txt4: If this feature is enabled and you wish to also allow normal access to the Live View page, the product's own IP address or host name must also be added to the list of allowed referrers.
restrictIP_h.refer_Txt5: Restricting referrers has no effect on an MPEG-4 video stream. To restrict an MPEG-4 stream, IP address filtering must be enabled.
restrictIP_h.refer_Txt6: Restricting referrers is of greatest value when not using IP address filtering (see above). If IP address filtering is used, allowed referrers are automatically restricted to allowed IP addresses.
restrictIP_h.refer_Txt7: If the check box has been selected but the Only allow referrals from field is empty, the functionality has not been enabled.

restrictIP_setup_h.allow_deny_Txt: This dialog allows you to add new allowed/denied IP addresses. These can be added individually one by one, or whole ranges (subnets) of IP addresses can be added directly.
restrictIP_setup_h.allow_1_Txt: This dialog allows you to add new allowed IP addresses. These can be added individually one by one, or whole ranges (subnets) of IP addresses can be added directly.
restrictIP_setup_h.add_Txt1: To add a subnet of network addresses, these must be added in CIDR notation.
restrictIP_setup_h.add_ipv4_6_Txt1: for IP v4, entering 192.168.1.0/24 will add all the addresses in the range 192.168.1.1 to 192.168.1.254.
restrictIP_setup_h.add_ipv4_6_Txt2: for IP v6, entering 12AB::/64 will add all the addresses in the range 12AB:0000:0000:0000:0000:0000:0000:0000 to 12AB:0000:0000:0000:ffff:ffff:ffff:ffff
restrictIP_setup_h.add_ipv4Txt: entering 192.168.1.0/24 will add all the addresses in the range 192.168.1.1 to 192.168.1.254.
restrictIP_setup_h.add_okTxt1: After adding a new IP address or range of addresses, click the OK button.
restrictIP_setup_h.add_okTxt2: Note: If you are accessing the Axis product via a proxy server, the IP address for the proxy server must be added as an allowed address.
restrictIP_setup_h.add_okTxt3: For more information on CIDR notation, please visit the Axis Support web.
